 <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CPN;a08ff191.1503">   <title>Final Special Issue CFP (15 Mar): The Globalisation of Local Real Estate: The Politics and Practice of Foreign Real Estate Investment </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CPN;a08ff191.1503</link>   <description> *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>The International Journal of Housing Policy<br>Special issue CFP:<br>The Globalisation of Local Real Estate: The Politics and Practice of Foreign Real Estate Investment<br><br>Guest Editors: Dallas Rogers (University of Western Sydney) and Sin Yee Koh (City University of Hong Kong)<br><br>The well-reported rise in Chinese investment in global real estate and the role that Asian investors are playing in Anglo-sphere real estate markets is emerging as a key site for critical housing scholarship. The increasing activity of middle class and superrich investors from Brazil, Russia, India, Indonesia, China, and South Africa (known collectively as the BRIICS) [...]    </description> <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CPN;7eb24765.1502</link>   <description> The Graduate School of East Asian Studies at Freie Universitaet Berlin<br>(Germany) is inviting applications for a Postdoctoral research fellowship<br>(until Dec 31st, 2017) with a focus on East Asian Security, beginning on 1<br>April 2015<br><br>Salary terms of E 13 TV-L in the German public sector<br><br>Job description:<br><br>The Graduate School brings together research in East Asian Studies<br>(Japanese, Korean and Chinese Studies) with training in the social sciences<br>(Political Science, Economics, Law, Social and Cultural Anthropology) as<br>well as History and Cultural Studies.
